He tried all methods to lose weight by going through different diet regimes and gym training but he would not lose the desired weight. He would get easily tired even if he would not work much. He was advised to do a thyroid test and his thyroid hormones were abnormally high. After detailed case history, he was given homeopathic medicine with diet changes and exercise routines. Slowly and steadily he improved and over a period of 3months the thyroid hormone levels were back to normal. He lost weight and looked more confident. He continued with homeopathic treatment for 1year and the thyroid hormones were normal. Unexplained weight gain, constipation, Sluggishness, Fatigue; Lack of Energy, Dry skin, Depression, Increased sensitivity to cold, Impaired memory, hair thinning, Muscle aches and pains, Heavier than normal or irregular menstrual periods, slower heart rate are common symptoms of Hypothyroid. Hypothyroid occurs when the thyroid gland fails to produce enough thyroid hormones. Hypothyroid is more common in women than men and the incidences increase with age. Hashimoto's Thyroiditis (thyroid gland enlarges and forms goitre), Thyroid destruction following secondary to radioactive surgery, Severe iodine deficiency, and Stress are known to cause Hypothyroid. A routine blood test for thyroid hormones would confirm the diagnosis.
